column4: is there a way to install windows to the HD from within linux? (not VM in a way that you can boot up into windows)
hes right :)
I'll help u if you would answer a simple question and this why?
why I want to install windows?

nah not with dx10. The main problem is I watch TV on the computer. And I use a payTV card. I cant get it to work in linux at all the only solution was to use a program called sasc-ng but it didnt work
dare I ask that wether u have anything of particular use in your newly installed linux os or a backup drive possibly?
then id just wipe it and install windows and then linux over it..
wil lsave u a headache or 2...
But I cant I have no disc
OH! no disc...yeeesh
Im guessing u lack a dvd burner as well...well
then why not make a bootable cd/dvd? they both work im sure..
did u mean can or cant?
when I put a dvd-r in ubuntu detects it as blank, but when I start burning the iso I get a medium incompatible or not formated error
Even though im sure my drive can handle it
hmm what softwar eare u using?
sorry for the burning process?
Brasero but Ive tried others and get same problem
If I could fix that all my problems would be solved but I couldn't find a solution
what was the error msg it gave u?
